intro: Argostemma oblongum, commonly known as the narrowleaf argostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
